post.description:
Authenticate user and return tokens.

Args:
    body: Login credentials.
    service: Auth service.

Returns:
    Access and refresh tokens with user/org info.

Register new user and create organization.

Args:
    body: Registration info.
    service: Auth service.

Returns:
    Access and refresh tokens with user/org info.

Refresh access token.

Args:
    body: Refresh token and org ID.
    service: Auth service.

Returns:
    New access token.

get.description: Get current authenticated user info.

schema.title: Response Get Current User Api V1 Auth Me Get

get.description:
Get all organizations the current user belongs to.

Returns list of orgs with role for each.

schema.title: Response Get User Orgs Api V1 Auth Me Orgs Get

post.description:
Get the recovery method for a user's email.

This tells the frontend what UI to show (email form, admin contact, etc.).

Args:
    body: Request containing the user's email.
    service: Auth service.
    recovery_adapter: Password recovery adapter.

Returns:
    Recovery method describing how the user can reset their password.

Request a password reset.

For security, this always returns success regardless of whether
the email exists. This prevents email enumeration attacks.

The actual recovery method depends on the configured adapter:
- email: Sends reset link via email
- console: Prints reset link to server console (demo/dev mode)
- admin_contact: Logs the request for admin visibility

Args:
    body: Request containing the user's email.
    service: Auth service.
    recovery_adapter: Password recovery adapter.
    frontend_url: Frontend URL for building reset links.

Returns:
    Success message.

schema.title: Response Request Password Reset Api V1 Auth Password Reset Request Post

post.description:
Reset password using a valid token.

Args:
    body: Request containing the reset token and new password.
    service: Auth service.

Returns:
    Success message.

Raises:
    HTTPException: If token is invalid, expired, or already used.

schema.title: Response Confirm Password Reset Api V1 Auth Password Reset Confirm Post

post.description:
Start a new investigation.

This endpoint starts an investigation in the background
and returns immediately with the investigation ID.

The investigation will query the tenant's actual data source
(e.g., DuckDB with parquet files) instead of just metadata.

get.description: Get investigation status and results.

SSE stream of investigation events.

Returns a Server-Sent Events stream that pushes
new events as they occur during the investigation.

List all investigations for the current tenant.

Results are filtered by RBAC permissions when user_id is available.
Admins and owners see all investigations; members see only those
they have access to via direct grants, tags, teams, or datasources.

schema.title: Response List Investigations Api V1 Investigations Get

get.description:
List all supported data source types.

Returns the configuration schema for each type, which can be used
to dynamically generate connection forms in the frontend.

post.description:
Test a connection without saving it.

Use this endpoint to validate connection settings before creating
a data source.

get.description: List all data sources for the current tenant.

post.description:
Create a new data source.

Tests the connection before saving. Returns 400 if connection test fails.

get.description: Get a specific data source.

post.description: Test connectivity for an existing data source.

get.description:
Get schema from a data source.

Returns unified schema with catalogs, schemas, and tables.

post.description:
Execute a query against a data source.

Only works for sources that support SQL or similar query languages.

Get statistics for columns in a table.

Only works for sources that support column statistics.

Sync schema and register/update datasets.

Discovers all tables from the data source and upserts them
into the datasets table. Soft-deletes datasets that no longer exist.

get.description: List datasets for a datasource.

Execute a query against a data source.

Only works for sources that support SQL or similar query languages.

get.description: List datasets for a datasource.
Get a dataset by ID with column information.
Get investigations for a dataset.
List all pending approval requests for this tenant.
Get approval request details including context to review.

post.description: Approve an investigation to proceed.
Reject an investigation.

Approve with modifications.

This allows reviewers to modify the investigation context before approving.
For example, they can adjust which tables are included, modify query limits, etc.

Create a new approval request.

This is typically called by the system when an investigation reaches
a point requiring human review (e.g., context review before executing queries).

get.description: Get all approval requests for a specific investigation.

schema.title: Response Get Investigation Approvals Api V1 Approvals Investigation  Investigation Id  Get

get.description: List all users for the tenant.

post.description:
Create a new user.

Requires admin scope.

get.description: Get the current authenticated user's profile.
List all members of the current organization (JWT auth).

schema.title: Response List Org Members Api V1 Users Org Members Get

post.description:
Invite a user to the organization (admin only).

If user exists, adds them to the org. If not, creates a new user.

schema.title: Response Invite User Api V1 Users Invite Post

get.description: Get a specific user.

patch.description:
Update a user.

Requires admin scope.

delete.description:
Deactivate a user (soft delete).

Requires admin scope. Users cannot delete themselves.

patch.description: Update a member's role in the organization (admin only).

schema.title: Response Update Member Role Api V1 Users  User Id  Role Patch

post.description: Remove a member from the organization (admin only).

schema.title: Response Remove Org Member Api V1 Users  User Id  Remove Post

get.description: Get dashboard overview for the current tenant.
Get just the dashboard statistics.

List all available lineage providers.

Returns the configuration schema for each provider, which can be used
to dynamically generate connection forms in the frontend.

Get upstream (parent) datasets.

Returns datasets that feed into the specified dataset.

Get downstream (child) datasets.

Returns datasets that depend on the specified dataset.

Get full lineage graph around a dataset.

Returns a graph structure with datasets, edges, and jobs.

Get column-level lineage.

Returns the source columns that feed into the specified column.
Not all providers support column lineage.

Get job details.

Returns information about a job that produces or consumes datasets.

Get recent runs of a job.

Returns execution history for the specified job.

Search for datasets by name or description.

Returns datasets matching the search query.

List datasets with optional filters.

Returns datasets from the lineage provider.

Get dataset details.

Returns metadata for a specific dataset.

post.description: Submit feedback on a hypothesis, query, evidence, synthesis, or investigation.

get.description:
Get current user's feedback for an investigation.

Args:
    investigation_id: The investigation to get feedback for.
    auth: Authentication context.
    db: Application database.

Returns:
    List of feedback items for the investigation.

schema.title: Response Get Investigation Feedback Api V1 Investigation Feedback Investigations  Investigation Id  Get
